moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 Nf6 4. Nc3 c6 5: Now the Houdini chess engine thinks white should play dxc5 Nxc5, Qc2 with a slightly bigger edge, but this is hard to understand why white has any advantage at all.
moves.10. Rc1 b6: a6 preparing b5 is slightly better.
moves.11. Qe2 Bb7 12. Rfd1: This is a pretty ordinary game up to this point.
moves.12... Bxf3: This move makes black's queenside weak therefore giving white the uppper hand.
moves.15. Ba6: The rook is going to run out of places to hide.
moves.15... Rb8 16. Bf4 e5: A desperate attempt to save the rook, but everything falls appart for black now.
moves.17. dxe5 Ne8 18. Bb5: Black loses at least a piece here and appears to be positionally crushed.
